description.narrative: (i) improving access of bilingual education in Tier II, Tier III and Tier IV cities in China, (ii) demonstration effect regarding the viability of moderately priced bilingual international education and (iii) contribution to employability of Chinese students in the long term.

China Maple Leaf Educational Systems Limited (Maple Leaf or the Company) operates the largest international school network in China, comprising over 13,500 students across 33 schools in eight cities located in China namely Dalian, Tianjin, Wuhan, Chongqing, Ordos, Luoyang, Shanghai and Zhenjiang. The Company offers a differentiated bilingual, dual-curriculum and dual-diploma programs. Maple Leaf is incorporated in the Cayman Islands and its operating subsidiaries are located in the Peoples Republic of China. The project under consideration is for the expansion of private K-12 school operations by Maple Leaf in China. To fund this growth, the Company is planning to raise US$100-150 million in an Initial Public Offering (IPO) currently scheduled for November 2014.
